author: jsonline
title: UW-Whitewater holds off Platteville
text:
No. 1-ranked UW-Whitewater finished the first half strong and then held 14th-ranked UW-Platteville's air attack in check to pick up a 17-7 victory in the Wisconsin Intercollegiate Athletic Conference opener for both Saturday in Whitewater.
The 21st annual George Chryst Bowl drew a WIAC and school-record crowd of 15,287 and marked the 36th consecutive win for the Warhawks (4-0), good for the longest in NCAA football.
A touchdown pass from Chris Nelson to Adam Korpela plus a 21-yard field goal from Lake Bachar gave Whitewater a 10-7 halftime lead.
Jordon Rattliffe's touchdown run early in the fourth quarter put the Warhawks ahead by 10.
Whitewater's defense did the rest as it held the Pioneers (3-1) to 263 total yards and produced six sacks.
UW-River Falls 21, UW-La Crosse 20 (overtime): Michael Diggins had two rushing touchdowns, including one in overtime, to help the host Falcons (2-2) ground the Eagles (1-3) in each team's conference opener.
Diggins' 2-yard plunge and Ryan Kusilek's extra point gave River Falls the upper hand in the extra session.
La Crosse then answered with a 25-yard touchdown pass from Trent Cummings to A.J. Day, but the Eagles' hopes for a second overtime were dashed when the extra-point attempt was blocked.
UW-Stevens Point 38, UW-Eau Claire 28: Kyle Larson threw for 265 yards and matched his career high with five touchdown passes in leading the Pointers (3-1) to a homecoming victory against the Blugolds (0-4) in a conference-opening tilt.
Larson hit Logan Taylor for a pair of scores in the second quarter to put Point ahead, 21-7, at halftime. He then connected with Jared Pankow in the third to give the Pointers a commanding 21-point lead.
UW-Oshkosh 69, UW-Stout 14: The Titans (3-1) ruined homecoming for the Blue Devils (1-3) by racking up a WIAC record 829 yards of total offense.
Oshkosh picked up 456 of its yards on the ground with Dylan Hecker (124 yards, three touchdowns) leading the way.
Brett Kasper threw for 350 of the Titans' 373 yards passing as he hit 22 of 29 attempts with three touchdowns.
Sam Mentkowski was Oshkosh's main receiving threat as he hauled in eight passes for 209 yards and a pair of touchdowns.
